sentence.Network_cn: 他闻到一股浓浓的油烟味。

sentence.Network_en: She was acutely aware of the noise of the city.

急性肾盂肾炎(acute pyelonephritis)是由细菌直接引起的肾盂、肾盏和肾实质的感染性炎症。本病多累及一侧肾脏，也可累及两侧肾脏。

entry.tran: 深深地（感觉到），强烈地(意识到)
entry.def: If you feel or notice something acutely, you feel or notice it very strongly.

example.ex: He was acutely aware of the odour of cooking oil...
example.tran: 他闻到一股浓浓的油烟味。

example.ex: Those tensions have been felt most acutely by women.
example.tran: 最能深切感受到这种紧张氛围的是女性。

entry.def: If a feeling or quality is acutely unpleasant, it is extremely unpleasant.

example.ex: It was an acutely uncomfortable journey back to London.
example.tran: 那是一次极其痛苦的返回伦敦的旅行。

auth_sentence.content: He was "acutely aware" of violent crime.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was "acutely aware" of violent crime.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was "acutely aware" of violent crime.

auth_sentence.content: He felt acutely melancholy, not very far from tears.
auth_sentence.res_content: He felt acutely melancholy, not very far from tears.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He felt acutely melancholy, not very far from tears.

auth_sentence.content: The country remains acutely vulnerable to natural disasters.
auth_sentence.res_content: The country remains acutely vulnerable to natural disasters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The country remains acutely vulnerable to natural disasters.

Sentence.sentence: Uncommonly severe droughts brought on by global climate changes have led to forest-eating wildfires from Australia to Indonesia, but nowhere more acutely than in the Amazon.
Even for those most acutely affected – say, low-skilled workers, or California residents – the impact isn't all that dramatic.
After surveying every option, a person is more acutely aware of the opportunities they had to turn down to pursue just one career.

means.word_mean: 深深感觉到；强烈意识到

sentences.en: I am acutely aware of the difficulties we face.
sentences.cn: 我十分清楚我们面临的困难。

sentences.en: They were acutely aware of the difficulties.
sentences.cn: 他们强烈地感到种种困难。
